intro: Racosperma phlebopetalum var. pubescens, commonly known as the hairy wattle, is a species of flowering plant in the legume family, Fabaceae. It is native to Australia and is characterized by its yellow floral spikes and hairy foliage. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as woodlands and grasslands. Its leaves are compound, consisting of several small, oval-shaped leaflets. The flowers are arranged in dense, cylindrical spikes and are pollinated by insects, contributing to its ecological significance in native ecosystems.
